DataElement.preferredName: BCR-ABL Oncoprotein And/Or Other Molecular Analysis Laboratory Procedure Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not BCR-ABL oncoprotein and or other molecular analyses were performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: BCR-ABL Oncoprotein And/Or Other Molecular Analysis Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An onco-protein generated from the fusion of Bcr and Abl genes by translocation process between chromosome 9 and 22 (Philadelphia chromosome), in CML (P210) and some ALL (P190)._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options_Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._Techniques for studying or analyzing the genetic composition and mechanisms of living organisms at the molecular level. May refer to the understanding and manipulation of genes (DNA)._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: BCR-ABL Oncoprotein And/Or Other Molecular Analysis Laboratory Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An onco-protein generated from the fusion of Bcr and Abl genes by translocation process between chromosome 9 and 22 (Philadelphia chromosome), in CML (P210) and some ALL (P190).:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options:Not otherwise specified.:Techniques for studying or analyzing the genetic composition and mechanisms of living organisms at the molecular level. May refer to the understanding and manipulation of genes (DNA).:A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.

Concepts.definition: A fusion protein encoded by the BCR/ABL1 fusion gene. This protein is comprised of the N-terminus of the breakpoint cluster region protein fused to almost the entire tyrosine-protein kinase ABL1 protein.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A laboratory procedure that involves the study of tissues, cells, and fluids using DNA/RNA analysis techniques for the identification of characteristics and abnormalities at the molecular level.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.
